notes: Interrupts Slark's channeling abilities upon cast
Deals 9/16/23/30 ([picture:talent_tree_symbol] 16/23/30/37) damage within a 325 radius in 0.1-second intervals, starting 1.5 seconds after cast for a total of 10 instances

Slark takes 2.7/4.8/6.9/9 ([picture:talent_tree_symbol] 4.8/6.9/9/11.1) damage in the same intervals, resulting in 27/48/69/90 ([picture:talent_tree_symbol] 48/69/90/111) total damage Applies a strong dispel on Slark in the same intervals, before each of its damage instances The self-damage is never lethal and it can be reduced or amplified

Dark Pact's visual and sound effects during the 1.5 seconds delay are only visible and audible to allies
 For enemies, they instantly see and hear the ability effects after the effect delay
The visual effects of the damaging pulses are visible even when Slark is invisible, but not in the Fog of War
Dark Pact ends 2.5 seconds after cast, but ends instantly upon Slark's death
Successive casts during the effect delay cancel the previous cast and starts a new cast
abilities.description: After a short delay, Slark sacrifices some of his life blood, purging most negative debuffs and dealing damage to enemy units around him and to himself. Slark only takes 30% of the damage.
abilities.name: Dark Pact
abilities.story: Slithereen are capable of quickly regrowing appendages, in case of critical injury, to save their own lives.

notes: Leaps at a speed of 933.33 ([picture:aghanim's_scepter_symbol] 1599.99) for up to 0.75 seconds Does not disjoint projectiles upon cast

Pounce have the following leap mechanics: Always leaps towards the direction Slark is facing
 Does not lock Slark's facing angle during the leap
 Always leaps the full distance, unless an enemy hero gets within 120 radius of Slark during the leap
 Moves Slark upwards over other units and over impassable terrain
Slark can turn and cast abilities and items during Pounce, but cannot attack

With the maximum distance and latch radius, Pounce can latch on enemy heroes up to 820 ([picture:aghanim's_scepter_symbol] 1320) range away Can only latch on heroes and clones Does not latch on illusions and creep-heroes Can latch on invisible units, but not on invulnerable or hidden units When latching on a unit, Slark is automatically ordered to attack the target Pounce first applies the leash debuff, then apply 0/1/2/3 [picture:essence_shift] Essence Shift stacks based on its current level Essence Shift notes fully apply If it is not learned, no stacks are applied

Stops the enemy by slowing their movement speed
 The slow gets exponentially stronger towards the edges of the 120 leash radius
 This effectively causes the target to come to halt if the leash is stretched too much
 The slow is only present when facing away from the center
 The target is not slowed when facing toward the center
 Since the slow is fluctuating a lot, it is not displayed in the HUD

The leashed enemy hero is prevented from casting certain mobility abilities If cast before getting leashed, the following abilities are not able to break the leash: [picture:skewer] Skewer, [picture:leap] Leap, [picture:pounce] Pounce, [picture:tree_dance] Tree Dance, [picture:primal_spring] Primal Spring, [picture:toggle_movement] Toggle Movement, and an enemy-targeted [picture:hurricane_pike] Hurricane Pike Every other position changing effect, can break the leash when stretching it beyond the maximum radius [picture:force_staff] Force Staff, [picture:hurricane_pike] Hurricane Pike, [picture:force_boots] Force Boots, and [picture:psychic_headband] Psychic Headband instantly dispel the Pounce debuff on the target, regardless of the maximum radius

When the leash expires while a position-changing effect (e.g knockback) is ongoing, it instantly cancels the position-changing effect This goes for the following abilities: [picture:flamebreak] Flamebreak, [picture:primal_roar] Primal Roar, [picture:power_cogs] Power Cogs, [picture:hookshot] Hookshot, [picture:vacuum] Vacuum, [picture:gust] Gust, [picture:boulder_smash] Boulder Smash, [picture:rolling_boulder] Rolling Boulder, [picture:geomagnetic_grip] Geomagnetic Grip, [picture:deafening_blast] Deafening Blast, [picture:tether] Tether, [picture:blinding_light] Blinding Light, [picture:adaptive_strike_%28strength%29] Adaptive Strike (Strength), [picture:blast_off%21] Blast Off!, [picture:charge_of_darkness] Charge of Darkness, [picture:greater_bash] Greater Bash, [picture:timber_chain] Timber Chain, [picture:walrus_punch] Walrus PUNCH!, [picture:force_staff] Force Staff and [picture:hurricane_pike] Hurricane Pike
Destroys trees within 100 radius around Slark upon landing

Pounce cannot be cast during Pounce
 During the leap, Pounce is on a non-refreshable cooldown which is bound to the leap buff

Deals 0 damage to the affected unit Fully procs on damage effects, such as [picture:corrosive_skin] Corrosive Skin, except for abilities which have a minimum damage threshold (e.g [picture:gravekeeper's_cloak] Gravekeeper's Cloak)
abilities.description: Slark leaps forward, grabbing the first hero he connects with and applying Essence Shift Stacks. That unit is leashed, and can only move a limited distance away from Slark's landing position.
abilities.name: Pounce
abilities.story: Time in the Dark Reef made Slark a dangerous assassin; aggressive and fearless.

notes: Essence Shift steals 1 of [picture:strength_attribute_symbol] / [picture:agility_attribute_symbol] / [picture:intelligence_attribute_symbol] all attributes ([picture:talent_tree_symbol] 2 [picture:agility_attribute_symbol] agility, 1 [picture:strength_attribute_symbol] strength and [picture:intelligence_attribute_symbol] intelligence respectively) before the attack damage is applied Effective stats loss from losing strength and intelligence per stack: 20 health, 0.1 health regeneration, 12 mana and 0.05 mana regeneration Effective stats loss from losing agility per stack: 0.17 ([picture:talent_tree_symbol] 0.33) main armor, 1 ([picture:talent_tree_symbol] 2) attack speed, and 1 ([picture:talent_tree_symbol] 2) main attack damage if the target is an [picture:agility_attribute_symbol] agility hero Effectively grants Slark 0.5 ([picture:talent_tree_symbol] 0.67) main armor, 3 ([picture:talent_tree_symbol] 4) attack speed and 3 ([picture:talent_tree_symbol] 4) main attack damage bonus per stack

Essence Shift cannot reduce any attribute below 0
 However, Slark continues to gain agility, even when the attacked hero has no more attributes left to steal
 This applies to the temporary steal, as well as the permanent steal

Each stack places a new buff on Slark and a new debuff on the affected enemy
 This means their durations are independent from each other
 The number of stacks and the duration of the last stack can be seen on the status buff icon
Upon death, the dying hero's attributes restore back to their normal values, while Slark keeps the bonus agility values for the remaining duration
When Slark dies, he loses all temporarily stolen attributes, but the affected enemies do not get theirs back, and vice versa
Can temporarily steal attributes from allies and clones, but not from illusions

Permanently stolen [picture:agility_attribute_symbol] agility is removed from the enemy's bonus agility and added to Slark's bonus agility Does not permanently steal agility if the enemy hero has Reincarnation, is an illusion, or from the [picture:arc_warden_tempest_double_minimap] Tempest Double Grants a stack in the following conditions as long as the Essence Shift debuff has not expired: The hero, including ally heroes, has to die within the 300 steal radius while having the Essence Shift debuff, including denied enemy heroes To permanently steal agility outside the steal radius, Slark has to be credited for the kill Other player-controlled units do not count Can steal independently from each [picture:divided_we_stand] Meepo Clones as long as it fulfill the conditions above Can steal agility even when Slark is dead as the kill happens
The number of stolen agility gained can be seen on the status buff icon
abilities.description: Slark steals the life essence of enemy heroes with his attacks, draining each of their attributes and converting them to bonus Agility. If Slark kills an affected enemy hero, he permanently steals 1 Agility.
abilities.name: Essence Shift
abilities.story: With each strike at his adversaries, Slark's knowledge of their weaknesses improves.

notes: Requires [picture:aghanim's_shard] Aghanim's Shard to be unlocked

Applies the Depth Shroud modifier based on the current level of Shadow Dance on allies within the area Shadow Dance notes fully apply If it is not learned, nothing happens upon cast, wasting mana and cooldown Does not prevent being revealed by [picture:chronosphere] Chronosphere

The modifier provides the same invisibility, movement speed, health regeneration and attack speed bonus as [picture:shadow_dance] Shadow Dance does The modifier fully stacks with those of Shadow Dance This means during Shadow Dance, Slark gains a total of 48%/72%/96% movement speed and 120/180/240 ([picture:talent_tree_symbol] 200/260/320) health regeneration bonus while affected by Depth Shroud TALENT NOTES The attack speed bonus is only granted while [picture:shadow_dance] Shadow Dance or Depth Shroud is active However, the attack speed bonus is not doubled

The buff is provided by an aura
 Its buff lingers for 0.5 seconds
Affects every allied unit, including [picture:animal_courier_radiant_minimap] Couriers, except buildings and wards Does not affect invulnerable or hidden units
Can regenerate up to 210/315/420 ([picture:talent_tree_symbol] 350/455/560) health over its full duration
abilities.description: Creates a cloud at the target location. All allies inside the radius are hidden and affected by Shadow Dance.
abilities.name: Depth Shroud

notes: Interrupts Slark's channeling abilities upon cast
Slark gains or loses the health regeneration and movement speed bonus 0.5 seconds after getting in or out of enemy vision, or casting Shadow Dance
If Slark is damaged by a neutral creep, the health regeneration and movement speed bonus are lost for 2 seconds

Upon cast, Slark turns invisible and cannot be revealed by anything However, the black cloud created is visible to enemies Does not grant phased movement Neither grants the health regeneration nor movement speed bonus when being targeted by an enemy [picture:snowball] Snowball

The invisibility is granted by an aura, however, its buff does not linger
 The aura does not affect invulnerable units, so if Slark turns invulnerable during it, he gets revealed
Can regenerate up to 3600/5400/7200 ([picture:talent_tree_symbol] 6000/7800/9600) health in one minute passively

While active, Shadow Dance can regenerate up to 240/382.5/540 ([picture:talent_tree_symbol] 400/552.5/720) health With the duration increasing [picture:talent_tree_symbol] talent, it can regenerate up to 500/682.5/880 health With both [picture:talent_tree_symbol] talents, it can regenerate up to 500/682.5/880 health
TALENT NOTES The attack speed bonus is only granted while Shadow Dance or [picture:depth_shroud] Depth Shroud is active
abilities.description: When used, Slark hides himself in a cloud of shadows, becoming immune to detection. Attacking, casting spells, and using items will not reveal Slark. Passively, when not visible to the enemy team, Slark gains bonus movement speed and health regeneration.
abilities.name: Shadow Dance
abilities.story: The hidden Thirteenth is a slippery foe.

description: Slips in and out of skirmishes. The only prisoner ever to escape from Dark Reef, Slark's abilities and ruthlessness are without equal. Pouncing into danger then slipping back out is what Slark does best. With every swing of his barnacle encrusted dagger, Slark steals his target's Essence, converting them to render himself more agile, striking harder and faster. He forges a Dark Pact, sacrificing his own lifeblood to dissipate negative energies that damage foes, and frees him from magical constraints. Concealing himself as he Dances through the Shadows, the Nightcrawler presents no visible target to would-be attackers. Hidden and Shrouded in this black haze, Slark escapes the inescapable and is always ready to to gut his enemies with little risk of retribution.  Carry Escape Disabler Nuker ★★☆
trivia: Slark is named after a rare murloc in World of Warcraft.
Slark's murloc heritage was completely removed in the transition to Dota 2 to avoid copyright issues, since the murlocs are an existing race in the Warcraft universe.
Slark's response Link▶️ "Met you once, cut you twice." is a reference to the carpentry phrase "measure twice, cut once".

Slark's respawn line Link▶️ "Griefer madness..." is a reference to the propaganda film Reefer Madness. As well, a griefer is a role a player assumes while in a multiplayer game to deliberately irritate other players.
Slark's weapon, a shiv, is the traditional prison weapon and is a reference to his backstory.
history: Little known to the inhabitants of the dry world, Dark Reef is a sunken prison where the worst of the sea-breed are sent for crimes against their fellows. It is a razor barbed warren full of murderous slithereen, treacherous Deep Ones, and sociopathic meranths. In this dim labyrinth, patrolled by eels and guarded by enormous anemones, only the vicious survive. Pitched into Dark Reef for crimes unknown, Slark spent half a lifetime without kin or kindness, trusting no one, surviving through a combination of stealth and ruthlessness, keeping his thoughts and his plans to himself. When the infamous Dark Reef Dozen plotted their ill-fated breakout, they kept their plans a perfect secret, murdering anyone who could have put the pieces together--but somehow Slark discovered their scheme and made a place for himself in it. Ten of the Dozen died in the escape attempt, and two were captured, hauled back to Dark Reef, then executed for the entertainment of their fellow inmates. But Slark, the unsung thirteenth, used the commotion as cover and slipped away, never to be caught. Now a furtive resident of the carnivorous mangrove scrub that grips the southern reach of Shadeshore, Slark remains the only successful escapee from Dark Reef.

hero_talents.talent_right: +1 Agility gain/stolen per Essence Shift Stack
